description: The AI Agent Orchestration subsystem coordinates multiple AI-driven agents to analyze source code, manage incremental updates, and produce structured analysis outputs. The main flow starts with the CodeBoardingAgent orchestrating metadata collection and delegating specific tasks to specialized agents (e.g., DiffAnalyzingAgent for change detection and LargeModelAgent for LLM-based interpretation). Agents interact with code-reading tools and data models, and their results are aggregated into a canonical AnalysisInsights schema that references Component entities. The purpose is to enable a cohesive, efficient, and AI-augmented code analysis pipeline that supports incremental analysis, LLM interpretation, and consistent output formatting.

components.name: CodeBoardingAgent
components.description: Central orchestrator managing the end-to-end analysis workflow: sequencing agents, interacting with LLMs and tools, and assembling final analysis results.

components.name: LargeModelAgent
components.description: Agent abstraction for interacting with Large Language Models (LLMs); sends prompts and receives structured LLM responses for interpretation tasks.

components.name: DiffAnalyzingAgent
components.description: Incremental analysis agent that detects codebase changes (e.g., via diffs), scopes affected regions, and filters files to enable efficient re-analysis.

components.name: AnalysisInsights
components.description: Canonical data model/schema that encapsulates aggregated analysis results, relationships, and findings produced by agents.

components.name: Component
components.description: Base data structure representing an identified software component during analysis; holds common attributes (name, type, references) used across analyses.
